pli-tv-pvr10:0.3.eng: 1. Training rules laid down in seven towns

pli-tv-pvr10:2.1.eng: “What has been laid down in the two Monastic Laws,

pli-tv-pvr10:2.2.eng: Which come up for recitation on the observance days—

pli-tv-pvr10:2.3.eng: How many training rules do they have?

pli-tv-pvr10:2.4.eng: In how many towns were they laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr10:3.3.eng: And so I will tell you,

pli-tv-pvr10:3.4.comm: The end quote in the Pali seems to be a mistake.

pli-tv-pvr10:4.1.eng: What has been laid down in the two Monastic Laws,

pli-tv-pvr10:4.2.eng: Which come up for recitation on the observance days—

pli-tv-pvr10:4.3.eng: They are three hundred and fifty,
pli-tv-pvr10:4.3.comm: This number seems to be the sum of all the rules in both Monastic Codes, with the rules in common between the nuns and the monks only counted once. Also, the seven principles for the settling of legal issues are not counted.

pli-tv-pvr10:5.1.eng: “In which seven towns were they laid down?

pli-tv-pvr10:5.3.eng: And after attending carefully to your explanation,

pli-tv-pvr10:5.4.eng: We will practice for our own benefit.”

pli-tv-pvr10:6.1.eng: “They were laid down at Vesālī, at Rājagaha,

pli-tv-pvr10:6.3.eng: And at Kosambī, and in the Sakyan country,

pli-tv-pvr10:7.1.eng: “How many were laid down at Vesālī?

pli-tv-pvr10:7.2.eng: How many were pronounced at Rājagaha?

pli-tv-pvr10:7.3.eng: How many were there at Sāvatthī?

pli-tv-pvr10:7.4.eng: How many were pronounced at Āḷavī?

pli-tv-pvr10:8.1.eng: How many were laid down at Kosambī?

pli-tv-pvr10:8.2.eng: How many were spoken in the Sakyan country?

pli-tv-pvr10:8.3.eng: How many were laid down among the Bhaggas?

pli-tv-pvr10:8.4.eng: Please tell me, the one who has asked.”

pli-tv-pvr10:10.1.eng: Six were laid down at Āḷavī,

pli-tv-pvr10:10.3.eng: Eight spoken in the Sakyan country,

pli-tv-pvr10:10.4.eng: And three laid down among the Bhaggas.

pli-tv-pvr10:11.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:11.3.comm: These are Bu Pj 1:7.1.16.1, Bu Pj 3:2.49.1, and Bu Pj 4:2.12.1.

pli-tv-pvr10:12.4.eng: These ten were pronounced at Vesālī.

pli-tv-pvr10:13.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:13.4.eng: Two on charging, and also two on schism.

pli-tv-pvr10:14.2.eng: And with complaining, having almsfood prepared;

pli-tv-pvr10:14.3.eng: A group meal, and at the wrong time,

pli-tv-pvr10:15.1.eng: Gives out a robe, giving directions—

pli-tv-pvr10:15.4.eng: With given consent it is twenty-one.

pli-tv-pvr10:16.1.comm: All rules not laid down in the six other towns were laid down at Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-pvr10:16.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:18.1.comm: According to Vmv 5.335 the ten are Bu Pd 1:1.35.1 and Bu Pd 3:3.15.1, plus Bi Pd 1:1.2.9.1–8.

pli-tv-pvr10:19.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:19.5.eng: And they pour water that contains living beings—

pli-tv-pvr10:19.6.eng: These six were pronounced at Āḷavī.

pli-tv-pvr10:20.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:20.3.eng: A large dwelling, difficult to correct,

pli-tv-pvr10:20.6.eng: The eighth is with a milk drink.

pli-tv-pvr10:21.1.eng: Those laid down in the Sakyan country,

pli-tv-pvr10:21.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:22.2.comm: MS reads aṭṭha, “eight”, whereas SRT has cha, “six”, which fits better.

pli-tv-pvr10:22.3.eng: With cleaning with water, and instruction,

pli-tv-pvr10:23.1.eng: Those laid down among the Bhaggas,

pli-tv-pvr10:23.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:23.3.eng: They lit a fire to warm themselves,

pli-tv-pvr10:25.1.eng: Two blameworthy offenses, and three on training—

pli-tv-pvr10:25.4.eng: By the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr10:27.1.eng: “What we have asked, you have answered,

pli-tv-pvr10:27.3.eng: I wish to ask you another question—please tell me this:

pli-tv-pvr10:27.6.eng: And those that are ‘after the third’.

pli-tv-pvr10:28.2.eng: The ways that failures are settled—
pli-tv-pvr10:28.2.comm: Reading vipattiyo with the PTS edition in place of vibhattiyo.

pli-tv-pvr10:28.4.eng: And we will listen to you.”

pli-tv-pvr10:29.3.eng: Those that are serious are grave,

pli-tv-pvr10:29.4.eng: Those that are grave are failures in morality;

pli-tv-pvr10:29.5.eng: Offenses entailing expulsion, offenses entailing suspension—

pli-tv-pvr10:30.2.eng: Offenses entailing acknowledgment, offenses of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr10:30.4.eng: And whoever calls another names for fun—

pli-tv-pvr10:30.5.eng: This is considered failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr10:31.2.eng: Preferring what is contrary to the true Dhamma;

pli-tv-pvr10:31.5.eng: This is considered failure in view.

pli-tv-pvr10:32.1.pli: Ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapati, ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā sañcarittaṃ samāpajjati, ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā ‘yo te vihāre vasati, so bhikkhu arahā’ti bhaṇati, ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā bhikkhu paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati, ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā bhikkhunī paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati, ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati.
pli-tv-pvr10:32.1.eng: When, to make a living—having bad desires, overcome by desire—one claims to have a non-existent superhuman quality; when, to make a living, one acts as a matchmaker; when, to make a living, one says, ‘The monk who stays in your dwelling is a perfected one;’ when, to make a living, a monk eats fine foods that he has requested for himself; when, to make a living, a nun eats fine foods that she herself has asked for; when, to make a living, one eats bean curry or rice that one has requested for oneself—

pli-tv-pvr10:32.2.eng: this is considered failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr10:33.2.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:33.3.eng: A nun who takes sides with one who has been ejected,

pli-tv-pvr10:34.4.eng: How many on ‘no other, he commits an offense entailing confession’?

pli-tv-pvr10:34.5.eng: How many on ‘the monks have agreed’?

pli-tv-pvr10:35.2.eng: Were laid down by the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun?”

pli-tv-pvr10:36.1.eng: “There are six on ‘to be cut down’.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.2.eng: There is one on ‘to be destroyed’.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.3.eng: There is one on ‘to be stripped’.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.4.eng: There are four on ‘no other, he commits an offense entailing confession’.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.5.eng: There are four on ‘the monks have agreed’.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.6.eng: There are seven on ‘what is proper’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.6.comm: Bu NP 10:1.3.1 and Bu NP 22:1.3.17.1; Bu Pc 34:1.2.21.1, Bu Pc 71:1.19.1, and Bu Pc 84:3.17.1, and the concluding section for each of the monks’ and the nuns’ saṅghādisesa offenses at Bu Ss 13:3.2.11 and Bi Ss 13:3.19 respectively.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.7.eng: There are fourteen on ‘at the most’.

pli-tv-pvr10:37.1.comm: Bu NP 30:1.27.1; Bu Pc 16:1.16.1, Bu Pc 20:1.12.1, Bu Pc 29:2.13.1, Bu Pc 36:1.28.1, Bu Pc 62:1.11.1–66, Bu Pc 69:1.11.1, Bu Pc 70:1.46.1, and Bu Pc 82:1.26.1; Bi Pj 6:1.23.1, Bi Ss 2:1.40.1; and Bi Pc 51:3.9.1.

pli-tv-pvr10:37.2.eng: They were laid down by the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.”

pli-tv-pvr10:38.1.comm: Leaving out the seven principles for settling legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr10:38.3.eng: Come up for recitation on the observance days,

pli-tv-pvr10:38.4.comm: Again, leaving out the seven principles for settling legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr10:38.6.eng: Come up for recitation on the observance days.

pli-tv-pvr10:39.2.eng: Are not in common with the nuns;

pli-tv-pvr10:39.3.eng: One hundred and thirty of the nuns’ rules,

pli-tv-pvr10:39.4.eng: Are not in common with the monks.

pli-tv-pvr10:40.1.eng: So one hundred and seventy-six in total,

pli-tv-pvr10:40.3.comm: Again, leaving out the seven principles for settling legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr10:40.4.eng: Are trained in equally by both.

pli-tv-pvr10:41.3.eng: Come up for recitation on the observance days,

pli-tv-pvr10:41.4.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:42.2.eng: There are thirteen offenses entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr10:43.4.eng: The seventy-five rules to be trained in.

pli-tv-pvr10:44.1.eng: These are the two hundred and twenty,

pli-tv-pvr10:44.3.eng: That come up for recitation on the observance days.

pli-tv-pvr10:45.3.eng: Come up for recitation on the observance days,

pli-tv-pvr10:45.4.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:46.2.eng: There are seventeen offenses entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr10:47.2.eng: The seventy-five rules to be trained in;

pli-tv-pvr10:47.3.eng: These are the three hundred and four,

pli-tv-pvr10:47.5.eng: That come up for recitation on the observance days.

pli-tv-pvr10:48.2.eng: Are not in common with the nuns;

pli-tv-pvr10:48.3.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:49.2.eng: With the two undetermined offenses are eight;

pli-tv-pvr10:50.4.eng: That the monks do not have in common with the nuns.

pli-tv-pvr10:51.1.eng: One hundred and thirty of the nuns’ rules,

pli-tv-pvr10:51.2.eng: Are not in common with the monks;

pli-tv-pvr10:51.3.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:52.2.eng: Ten offenses where one is sent away from the Sangha;

pli-tv-pvr10:53.1.eng: These are the one hundred and thirty,

pli-tv-pvr10:53.2.eng: That the nuns do not have in common with the monks.

pli-tv-pvr10:53.5.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:54.2.eng: There are sixteen offenses entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr10:54.3.eng: There are the two undetermined offenses,

pli-tv-pvr10:55.1.eng: These are the hundred and seventy-six,

pli-tv-pvr10:55.2.eng: That the two do not have in common.

pli-tv-pvr10:55.4.eng: Are trained in equally by both;

pli-tv-pvr10:55.5.eng: Listen to them as they truly are:

pli-tv-pvr10:56.2.eng: There are seven offenses entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr10:56.5.eng: Seventy-five rules to be trained in.

pli-tv-pvr10:57.1.eng: These are the hundred and seventy-four,

pli-tv-pvr10:57.2.eng: That are trained in equally by both.

pli-tv-pvr10:57.3.eng: The eight offenses entailing expulsion are dangerous to meet with:
pli-tv-pvr10:57.3.comm: SP 5.338: Tattha durāsadāti iminā tesaṁ sappaṭibhayataṁ dasseti, “There durāsadā: by this is shown their danger.”

pli-tv-pvr10:57.4.eng: That person is like the simile of the palm stump,

pli-tv-pvr10:58.1.eng: Like a withered leaf, like an ordinary stone that has broken in half,

pli-tv-pvr10:58.2.eng: Like someone with their head cut off;

pli-tv-pvr10:58.3.eng: Like a palm-tree with its top cut off,

pli-tv-pvr10:59.4.eng: One hundred and eighty-eight offenses entailing confession;

pli-tv-pvr10:60.1.eng: Seventy-five rules to be trained in.

pli-tv-pvr10:60.2.eng: They are settled through three principles for settling legal issues:

pli-tv-pvr10:60.3.eng: In the presence of, and with the admission of,

pli-tv-pvr10:60.4.eng: And through covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr10:61.1.eng: There are two observance days, two invitation days,

pli-tv-pvr10:61.2.eng: And four legal procedures taught by the Victor.

pli-tv-pvr10:61.3.eng: There are five recitations, and four, not otherwise;
pli-tv-pvr10:61.3.comm: This probably refers to the monks’ five ways of reciting the Monastic Code, mentioned at Kd 2:15.1.4, and then the four ways for nuns, referred to at Pvr 2.1:1.8 and in the ensuing discussion.

pli-tv-pvr10:61.4.eng: And there are seven classes of offenses.

pli-tv-pvr10:62.1.eng: The four kinds of legal issues,

pli-tv-pvr10:62.3.eng: Through two of them, through four, through three,

pli-tv-pvr10:62.4.eng: And business is settled through one.”

pli-tv-pvr10:63.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:63.3.eng: When one has fallen away, offended, and fallen down,

pli-tv-pvr10:63.5.eng: And excluded from the community there—

pli-tv-pvr10:63.6.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:64.1.eng: It is said, ‘An offense entailing suspension’.

pli-tv-pvr10:64.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:64.5.eng: Gives the trial period, and rehabilitates—

pli-tv-pvr10:64.6.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:65.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:65.5.eng: It is one of three cases—

pli-tv-pvr10:66.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:66.3.eng: The one who confesses to instigating another,

pli-tv-pvr10:66.4.eng: And the one who agrees to it—

pli-tv-pvr10:66.5.eng: There is no offense like that.
pli-tv-pvr10:66.5.comm: Sp 5.339: Catutthagāthāya accayo tena samo natthīti desanāgāminīsu accayesu tena samo thūlo accayo natthi, “In the fourth verse, ‘There is no offense like that,’ means that in regard to the offenses that are to be confessed, there is no gross offense that is equivalent to that.”

pli-tv-pvr10:66.6.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:67.1.eng: It is said, ‘An offense entailing relinquishment’.

pli-tv-pvr10:67.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:67.3.eng: In the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group,

pli-tv-pvr10:67.6.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:68.1.eng: It is said, ‘An offense entailing confession’.

pli-tv-pvr10:68.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:68.6.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:69.1.eng: It is said, ‘An offense entailing acknowledgment’.

pli-tv-pvr10:69.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:69.4.eng: Whatever food she has obtained with difficulty;

pli-tv-pvr10:69.5.eng: Should he receive it himself and eat it,

pli-tv-pvr10:70.2.eng: And a nun there gives directions based on favoritism;

pli-tv-pvr10:70.3.eng: If they eat there without having stopped her,

pli-tv-pvr10:71.1.eng: Going to a family that has faith,

pli-tv-pvr10:71.2.eng: But is poor with little wealth;

pli-tv-pvr10:71.3.eng: If one eats there without being sick,

pli-tv-pvr10:72.1.eng: If anyone stays in a wilderness,

pli-tv-pvr10:72.3.eng: And they eat there without making it known,
pli-tv-pvr10:72.3.comm: I take aviditaṁ to be a contracted version of appaṭisaṁviditaṁ, see Bu Pd 4:2.12.1.

pli-tv-pvr10:73.5.eng: If she herself asks for them,

pli-tv-pvr10:73.6.eng: She has committed a blameworthy act in the instruction of the Accomplished One.

pli-tv-pvr10:74.1.eng: It is said, ‘An offense of wrong conduct’.

pli-tv-pvr10:74.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:74.4.eng: Faltered, and what is badly done.

pli-tv-pvr10:75.1.eng: Whatever people do that is bad,

pli-tv-pvr10:75.2.eng: Whether in public or in private;

pli-tv-pvr10:75.3.eng: They declare to be wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr10:75.4.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:76.1.eng: It is said, ‘An offense of wrong speech’.

pli-tv-pvr10:76.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:76.6.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:77.1.eng: It is said, ‘To be trained in’.

pli-tv-pvr10:77.2.eng: Listen to it as it truly is:

pli-tv-pvr10:77.3.eng: For a trainee who is training,

pli-tv-pvr10:78.1.eng: This is the beginning and the right conduct,

pli-tv-pvr10:78.2.eng: With a controlled and restrained mouth—

pli-tv-pvr10:78.3.eng: There is no training like this.

pli-tv-pvr10:78.4.eng: This is why it is called that.

pli-tv-pvr10:79.4.eng: And it won’t be rained upon.

pli-tv-pvr10:80.1.eng: The forest is the destination of deer,

pli-tv-pvr10:80.2.eng: The air is the destination of birds;

pli-tv-pvr10:80.3.eng: Non-existence is the destination of phenomena,

pli-tv-pvr10:80.4.eng: Extinguishment is the destination of a Perfected One.”

pli-tv-pvr10:81.1.eng: The verses on the training rules  are finished.

pli-tv-pvr10:83.2.eng: And also the four kinds of failure;

pli-tv-pvr10:83.4.eng: Between the monks and the nuns;

pli-tv-pvr10:83.6.eng: There are these verses on the training rules.”

pli-tv-pvr10:84.1.eng: The verses on the training rules  are finished.
